text:
Hi guys, I'm Laura Vitale and on this episode
of Laura in the Kitchen, I'm going to show

you how to make the easiest but most delicious
pumpkin dip ever!

It literally requires a few ingredients, comes
together in about 90 seconds flat, it does

need to rest in the fridge for a little bit,
but it is so good, perfect for party time

this time of year and you're - I LOVE PARTIES
THIS TIME OF YEAR!
- I love it!

I love it so much and you're going to love
it too!

Let me run you through the list of ingredients,
because like I said, it's not very long but
they're all the right ones.
What I've got here is some cool whip.

You can use freshly whipped but really Cool
Whip holds up way better.
So go ahead and use the cool whip.

I need some cream cheese that's been softened
at room temperature, it's been sitting on

my stove, and then I have some powdered sugar,
pure pumpkin puree, and then in here I've

got some instant vanilla pudding and I also
have some pumpkin pie spice.
And you'll also need some vanilla extract.
So good, just you wait!

First thing I want to work on is creaming
together the cream cheese and the pumpkin.

This has got like the flavor of Pumpkin Mousse
meets Pumpkin Cheesecake, that's why I love

it so much, I'm also going to add the powdered
sugar and I'm just going to cream this together

until it's all really well combined because
then everything else doesn't need to be combined
as much and I don't want to over beat this.
So this part, let it go.

Add your pudding and your pudding and your
spice, just mix that in, hold on.

We're going to give it a little scrape around
the edges to make sure everything's incorporated

and once that pudding and the pumpkin pie
spice is incorporated, we'll add the jello
at the very last minute.

Add your cool whip, I kind of start it by
hand and I just finish it with my mixer, I
find that that's just the easiest way.

You know, I worked out this morning, upper
body, and my arm is so tired that this feels
like a workout.
What a shrimp!

Alright, let's just mix it all in, now I'm
just going to switch to my whisk again just

to make sure it's all well incorporated, I'm
sorry about the cord.
I have to invest in a cordless one.
But just mix it all in.
Don't forget your vanilla as well.
That looks magnificent!

What I'm going to do now is I'm just going
to cover this with some plastic wrap, pop

it in the fridge to rest for a bit and then
I'm going to transfer it to a different bowl,
get some cookies and serve.
And I'm so excited and I know you are too!

My dip has been in the fridge for a couple
of hours, it has chilled it has set the consistency

is dynamite, I just put it in a bowl with
some cookies or what not around it, I actually

prefer slices of apple with this dip because
I think the crunchy fresh slightly tart against

the creamy sweet is on point, but you have
to have some vanilla wafers you could do gingerbread

cookies, you could do whatever cookie you
desire because you're the boss applesauce.

But I'm going to go in with my apple, and
my dip which the consistency is like perfection.
Mmm!
You haven't lived until you've had this.

So good, so easy, a crowd pleaser and a hit
everywhere you take it ti, I think of my girlfriend

Jaime when I make this because it's one of
her favorite things in the entire world, so

I want you to make it because I'm 100%sure
that you will love it as much as she does.

LauraintheKitchen.com has the recipe for you
I hope you have enjoyed spending time with
me and I will see you next time.
Bye.
